content.text: Write the following in order of size, smallest first
Use a calculator to work out the following
Find the circumference of a circle of radius \(2.5\mathrm{cm}\)
Bruce plays a game of golf
His scores for each of the 18 holes are shown below
The information is to be shown in a pie chart
Calculate the sector angle for the score of 4
Add one line to the diagram so that it has two lines of symmetry
Add two lines to the diagram so that it has rotational symmetry of order 2
Rearrange the formula to make \(x\) the subject
Find the area of the trapezium
A hemisphere has a radius of \(12\mathrm{cm}\)
[The volume, \(V,\) of a sphere with radius \(r\) is \(V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3.\) ]
The exterior angle of a regular polygon is \(36^{\circ}\)
What is the name of this polygon?
The table shows how the dollar to euro conversion rate changed during one day
How many more euros did Khalil receive if he changed his money at the highest rate compared to the lowest rate?
The speed, \(\nu\), of a wave is inversely proportional to the square root of the depth, \(d\), of the water
A circle has a radius of \(8.5 \mathrm{cm}\) correct to the nearest \(0.1 \mathrm{cm}\)
The lower bound for the area of the circle is \(p \pi \mathrm{cm}^2\)
The upper bound for the area of the circle is \(q \pi \mathrm{cm}^2\)
Find the value of \(p\) and the value of \(q\)
Pam wins the student of the year award in New Zealand
She sends three photographs of the award ceremony by post to her relatives
· one of size \(13\mathrm{cm}\) by \(23\mathrm{cm}\) to her uncle in Australia
· one of size \(15\mathrm{cm}\) by \(23\mathrm{cm}\) to her sister in China
· one of size \(23\mathrm{cm}\) by \(35\mathrm{cm}\) to her mother in the UK

table.html:
Maximum lengthsAustraliaRest of the world
13 cm by 23.5 cm\(\)1.90\(\(\)2.50\(
15.5 cm by 23.5 cm\(\)2.40\(\(\)2.90\(
23 cm by 32.5 cm\(\)2.80\(\(\)3.40\(
26 cm by 38.5 cm\(\)3.60\(\(\)5.20\(

content.text: The cost of postage is shown in the table above
Use this information to calculate the total cost
\(A, B\) and \(C\) are points on the circumference of a circle centre \(O\)
\(OAD\) is a straight line and angle \(DAB = 142^{\circ}\)
Find the co-ordinates of the point of intersection of the two lines
Find the co-ordinates of the midpoint of the line \(AB\)
Find the equation of the line \(AB\)
Show that the point (3, 17) lies on the line \(AB\)
\(ABCDEF\) is a regular hexagon and \(O\) is the midpoint of \(AD\)
Find, in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{c}\), in their simplest form
the probability that a person chosen at random spends 2 hours or less in the museum
During one day 48 people visited a museum
The length of time each person spent in the museum was recorded
The results are shown on the cumulative frequency diagram
In triangle \(ABC, AB = 6 \text{cm}, BC = 4 \text{cm}\) and angle \(BCA = 65^\circ\)
